content.question: The phrase “The colours of my history had seeped out of my mind’s eye” in the second paragraph is best interpreted as meaning

choices.label: the author could no longer remember his early years in Bombay
the author realized that his childhood was less interesting than he’d remembered
the author’s memory could no longer recall the vivid details of the past
the author’s imagination could not alter the true nature of the past

content.answer: the author’s memory could no longer recall the vivid details of the past

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Explain how word choice, comparisons, and syntax contribute to the specific tone or style of a text.
